p: The analyses showed that the most important predictor of risk perception was age (β = 0.134) with 13.4% of variance followed by education level (β = −0.060, 6%). This model with all of the defined independent variables explains the 19% variance of risk perception ( R 2 = 0.25, Adj. R 2 = 0.19, F = 4.16, t = 16.47, p < 0.01). The remaining variables did not have significant effects on the perception of risk ( Table 2).
